verbs.description: rototill (third-person singular simple present rototills, present participle rototilling, simple past and past participle rototilled)

entries.meaning: (US) To break up and turn soil using a rototiller.
examples: We had to rototill the garden before we planted the flowers.

entries.meaning: (software) To make extensive and pervasive changes to a piece of code without altering its functionality.
